original: Jacobson, Karl Erik, direktör, Göteborg, f. 15/11/93 i Gbg av Alexander J. o. Olga Bodach. G. 33 m. Asta Stenson. — Lärov. 09, hand:inst. 11, hand :högsk. 17-18. Korresp. h. John Lyon & Co. A-B i Gbg 11-13, A-B Sjöberg & Bengtson i Gbg 13-18, inköpschef v. A-B Götaverken 18-31, kamr. där 31, dir. 44, v. verkst. dir. 45 o. verkst. dir. sed. 47. Led. av styr. f. A-B Götaverken, A-B Gbgs Skeppsdockor, Öresundsvarvet A-B i Landskrona o. A-B Davy Robertsons Ma-skinfabr. i Gbg, en av huv imännen i Gbgs Sparbank. RVO.
translated: Jacobson, Karl Erik, Director, Gothenburg, born on November 15th, 1893 in Gothenburg to Alexander J. and Olga Bodach. Married in 1933 to Asta Stenson. Completed secondary education in 1909, attended the Handelsinstitut in 1911, and the Handelshögskolan from 1917-1918. Corresponded for John Lyon & Co. A-B in Gothenburg from 1911-1913, worked for A-B Sjöberg & Bengtson in Gothenburg from 1913-1918, served as purchasing manager at A-B Götaverken from 1918-1931 and was a chamberlain there in 1931. Became a director in 1944, vice managing director in 1945 and managing director since 1947. He is a member of the board of directors for A-B Götaverken, A-B Gbgs Skeppsdockor, Öresundsvarvet A-B in Landskrona and A-B Davy Robertsons Machinefabr. in Gothenburg. Karl Erik Jacobson was one of the main individuals in Gothenburg Sparbank. He was awarded the Order of Vasa. Note that '\d\d m. partners name' means that the person married in the year 19xx.
